Series V: Affiliated and Allied Organizations
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Subseries V.B: Association of Lithuanian Workers (Lietuviu Darbininku Susivienijimas, aka LDS)
Subseries V.B: Association of Lithuanian Workers (Lietuviu Darbininku Susivienijimas, aka LDS)

The Association of Lithuanian Workers, or LDS (Lietuviu Darbininku Susivienijimas), was founded in 1930 as a fraternal organization politically oriented toward the CPUSA. From 1953 to 1957 the LDS was on the U.S. Attorney General's list of subversive organizations. As of 2003, the LDS continued to administer an insurance program, and in 2006 the LDS was merged into the Royal Arcanum, a non-ethnically-based fraternal organization. Although founded in New York, the bulk of the subseries derives from the organization's activity in Chicago and its environs, where Lithuanian American radicalism was centered. This subseries holds some correspondence, notably between the U.S. Attorney General's office and Jacob Pauliukas, the editor of the LDS' Chicago Lithuanian language newspaper Vilnis. There are also files on allied Lithuanian American progressive organizations and on Lithuanian World War II war criminals. Some scrapbooks are also in this subseries, including two which pertain to the life and work of Sophie Kaross, a Lithuanian American Communist. Much of the material is in Lithuanian.
